SEARCH
Module melange.common
Package gbw.melange.common.shading.components

Interface IAtomicShader

public interface IAtomicShader
An AtomicShader is not the most performant shader abstraction ever, but highly flexible. Consider using specializations for specific purposes

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    bind()
    Bind all resources currently available to this shader for manual use.
    void
    render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh mesh, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4 appliedMatrix)
    Regardless of the amount of shaders present, all available will be rendered in the order: Vertex -> Geometry -> Fragment to the mesh provided and with the matrix applied.
    Error
    setFragment(IFragmentShader fragment, boolean deleteExisting)
    See setVertex(IVertexShader, boolean)
    Error
    setGeometry(IGeometryShader geometry, boolean deleteExisting)
    See setVertex(IVertexShader, boolean)
    Error
    setVertex(IVertexShader vertex, boolean deleteExisting)
    Set the vertex shader, detach the old one and replace and relink.
    void
    unbind()
    Unbind all resources that might have been bound by manual use of this shader.

  • Method Details

    • setVertex

      Error setVertex(IVertexShader vertex, boolean deleteExisting)
      Set the vertex shader, detach the old one and replace and relink. If the new one hasn't been compiled yet, it will be and any error returned.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the new vertex shader to couple
      deleteExisting - if one was already provided, delete it.
      Returns:
      an error describing what went wrong or Error.NONE

    • setFragment

      Error setFragment(IFragmentShader fragment, boolean deleteExisting)
      See setVertex(IVertexShader, boolean)

    • setGeometry

      Error setGeometry(IGeometryShader geometry, boolean deleteExisting)
      See setVertex(IVertexShader, boolean)

    • render

      void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh mesh, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4 appliedMatrix)
      Regardless of the amount of shaders present, all available will be rendered in the order: Vertex -> Geometry -> Fragment to the mesh provided and with the matrix applied.
      Parameters:
      mesh - non null
      appliedMatrix - non null

    • bind

      void bind()
      Bind all resources currently available to this shader for manual use. You will absolutely mess up OpenGL if you change the components of this shader using setFragment(IFragmentShader, boolean), setVertex(IVertexShader, boolean) or setGeometry(IGeometryShader, boolean) while bound.

    • unbind

      void unbind()
      Unbind all resources that might have been bound by manual use of this shader.
